title: The Lucy show. Volume 2
brief_description: Lucille Ball stars as Lucy Carmichael, a widowed mother with two children living in California. She falls into a job when visiting the Vice President of the Bank, Theodore J Mooney (Gale Gordon), but is far from being a competent secretary. This tape includes four madcap tales including: “Little old lady”; at a banquet to celebrate the bank’s fiftieth anniversary Lucy dresses up as an old lady to act as chaperone to the banks 80 year old founder; Cornelius Heatherington Jr. Guest starring Dennis Day and directed by Jack Donohue. “Lucy & George Burns”; George Burns calls into the bank to collect a dividends statement. He laments the fact that he had to stop working because he ran out of comediennes, until he meets a possible leading lady; Lucy. Guest starring George Burns and directed by Maury Thompson. “Lucy gets trapped”; Lucy feigns an illness so that he she can go to a department store sale. All goes well until she is rewarded with being the 10 millionth customer and has her photograph in the paper. Directed by Jack Donohue. “Lucy & John Wayne”; Lucy delivers a contract to John Wayne, in person, despite strict instructions from Mr Mooney that she is to drop it off at reception. Guest starring John Wayne and directed by Maury Thompson. Based on the book “Life without George” by Irene Kampen.
